title: Ricky Schmitt
text:
Ricky William Schmitt (born August 17, 1985) is a former <a href="gridiron%20football">gridiron football</a> <a href="Punter%20%28American%20football%29">punter</a> and <a href="place%20kicker">place kicker</a>. He was signed by the <a href="Arizona%20Cardinals">Arizona Cardinals</a> as an <a href="undrafted%20free%20agent">undrafted free agent</a> in 2007. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Shepherd%20University">Shepherd University</a>.
Schmitt was also a member of the <a href="San%20Diego%20Chargers">San Diego Chargers</a>, <a href="Pittsburgh%20Steelers">Pittsburgh Steelers</a>, <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a>, <a href="San%20Francisco%2049ers">San Francisco 49ers</a>, <a href="Tennessee%20Titans">Tennessee Titans</a>, <a href="Saskatchewan%20Roughriders">Saskatchewan Roughriders</a>, and <a href="BC%20Lions">BC Lions</a>.
Early years.
Schmitt graduated from <a href="Salem%20High%20School%20%28Virginia%20Beach%2C%20Virginia%29">Salem High School</a> in <a href="Virginia%20Beach%2C%20Virginia">Virginia Beach, Virginia</a> in 2003, but did not play <a href="high%20school%20football">football</a> until his senior year. A four-year <a href="Varsity%20team">varsity</a> <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">letterman</a> in <a href="soccer">soccer</a>, Schmitt only went out for football due to the Sun Devils' need for a kicker. He was named an all-Beach District punter/kicker his senior year. He also played <a href="High%20school%20basketball">basketball</a>. Schmitt was offered a <a href="scholarship">scholarship</a> to play <a href="soccer">soccer</a> for <a href="Virginia%20Tech">Virginia Tech</a>.
College career.
Schmitt played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Shepherd%20University">Shepherd University</a>, a <a href="NCAA%20Division%20II">Division II</a> school in <a href="West%20Virginia">West Virginia</a>. He was one of the premier punters/kickers in the <a href="NCAA">NCAA</a>. In <a href="2006%20in%20sports">2006</a> he would have been among the leaders of all divisions in punting statistics however his offense only allowed him to punt 41 times (not enough to qualify for the leaders). In spring testing Schmitt was one of the fastest members of the Shepherd University squad recording <a href="40-yard%20dash">40-yard dash</a> times in the 4.4’s. He is a three-time first team All-<a href="WVIAC">WVIAC</a> selection as a punter and a two-time first team selection as a kicker. 2006 Daktronics Division II First Team All-Northeast Region selection and a second-team <a href="All-American">All-American</a> in 2006.
Additionally Schmitt holds virtually all Shepherd kicking records including:
Schmitt punted 41 times for a 44 average, with a long of 77, and 22 punts inside the 20 in 2006. A master of directional punts, with a 5 sec. hangtime only 17 of his punts were returned. He had eighteen kickoffs for touchbacks.
Professional career.
Arizona Cardinals.
Schmitt was signed as an <a href="undrafted%20free%20agent">undrafted free agent</a> by the <a href="Arizona%20Cardinals">Arizona Cardinals</a> following the <a href="2007%20NFL%20Draft">2007 NFL Draft</a>. He was cut on August 27. During the Cardinals preseason, Ricky punted 3 times for 114 yards, for an average of 38 yards.
First stint with 49ers.
Schmitt signed with the <a href="San%20Francisco%2049ers">San Francisco 49ers</a> on January 15, 2008. He was cut on August 30. During the 49ers preseason, Ricky kicked off twice with both going for <a href="touchback">touchback</a>s, punted 3 times for 131.1 yards, with 2 landing inside the 20 and a long of 54, for an average of 43.7 yards, and went 3 for 4 on field goals.
Pittsburgh Steelers.
Schmitt was signed to the <a href="practice%20squad">practice squad</a> of the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Steelers">Pittsburgh Steelers</a> on October 28, 2008. He was released on November 1.
Oakland Raiders.
Schmitt was signed to the <a href="practice%20squad">practice squad</a> of the <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a> on December 15, 2008. On December 30, he signed a two-year contract with the Raiders. He was cut on September 5, 2009. During the Raiders preseason, Ricky punted 18 times for 729 yards, with 5 landing inside the 20, for an average of 40.5 yards, and went 6 for 6 on extra points.
Second stint with 49ers.
Schmitt re-signed with the <a href="San%20Francisco%2049ers">San Francisco 49ers</a> on December 22, 2009. In his first regular season game against the <a href="Detroit%20Lions">Detroit Lions</a> on December 27, Ricky kicked off 5 times for 325 yards with 1 touchback, for an average of 65 yards, and also went 2 for 3 on field goals (1blocked) and 2 for 2 on extra points. He was placed on <a href="injured%20reserve">injured reserve</a> with a groin injury on January 2, 2010. On March 5, he became a free agent.
Tennessee Titans.
Schmitt was signed by the <a href="Tennessee%20Titans">Tennessee Titans</a> on March 15, 2010. He was cut on August 31. During the Titans preseason, Ricky kicked off 3 times for 205 yards with 2 touchbacks, for an average of 68.3 yards, and punted 2 times for 110 yards, with 1 landing inside the 20 and a long of 65, for an average of 55 yards. He did not attempt any field goals or extra points.
San Diego Chargers.
Schmitt was signed by the <a href="San%20Diego%20Chargers">San Diego Chargers</a> on January 20, 2011. He was cut on September 3. During the Chargers preseason, Ricky kicked off 14 times for 830 yards, with 8 touchbacks and 1 landing out of bounds, for an average of 59.3 yards, and punted 5 times for 215 yards, with 1 landing inside the 20 and a long of 50, for an average of 43 yards. He did not attempt any field goals or extra points.
Second stint with Cardinals.
Schmitt re-signed with the <a href="Arizona%20Cardinals">Arizona Cardinals</a> on May 14, 2012. He was cut on August 24. During the Cardinals preseason, Ricky kicked off 5 times for 339 yards with 2 touchbacks, for an average of 67.8 yards, and punted 12 times for 537 yards, with 3 landing inside the 20 and a long of 56, for an average of 44.8 yards. He did not attempt any field goals or extra points.
Saskatchewan Roughriders.
Schmitt was signed by the <a href="Saskatchewan%20Roughriders">Saskatchewan Roughriders</a> on November 2, 2012. He played in the first round of the CFL playoffs. Saskatchewan lost to Calgary 36-30.
During the 2013 CFL season, Schmitt punted 136 times for 6114 yards, for an average of 45 yards. He had a long of 74.
Schmitt won the <a href="101st%20Grey%20Cup">101st Grey Cup</a> with the Roughriders in 2013. In 2014, Schmitt became a free agent.
BC Lions.
On February 20, 2014, Schmitt signed with the <a href="BC%20Lions">BC Lions</a> After playing one season for the Lions, the option year on his contract was not picked up and he became a <a href="free%20agent">free agent</a>.
